title: Joe Sugg told to 'get his act together' by Shirley Ballas over Strictly claim
text:

Joe Sugg has been told to 'get his act together' if he wanted to realise a dance dream with Shirley Ballas.

The 27-year-old YouTuber co-hosts the Strictly Come Dancing podcast with Kim Winston and he had previously declared his desire to dance a Rhumba, as he didn't get the chance last year when he reached the final with Dianne Buswell.

Despite claiming he was "desperate" to hit the dance floor to put his best foot forward, 59-year-old Strictly head judge Shirley, has said that she is still waiting for his call.

Speaking on the podcast, Shirley refuted Joe's desires, saying: "Well you’re not that desperate Joe as I’m still waiting for you to call and schedule an appointment.

(Image: Getty Images)

“I think you’re a little bit nervous actually, you’ve been promising to call, you have not got your act together young man.

“I’m still sitting here growing cobwebs waiting for you.”

Kim asked how the pair would be scored by her fellow judges, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli, and Shirley was adamant there would be only one mark she would get - though wasn't so sure about Joe's contribution.

(Image: Getty Images)

Laughing at the prospect, Shirley said: "Well I’d get a 10. But I’m not sure about you Joe, anyway bring it on Joe I’m waiting.”

Joe admitted that he had had thoughts of contacting Shirley but hadn't taken the leap of faith.

He explained: "I think ages ago we said, obviously there was two dances I didn’t get to do, the Tango and the Rhumba and she said, ‘I’m the queen of Rhumba.’

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

“And then I was like, ‘We’ve got to do a dance together,’ you know like two boxers, they obviously want to fight each other, but it’s just trying to get it sorted.”

Joe insisted that he would be in touch and has set a target for him to take to the dancefloor with Shirley.

He said: "It needs to happen before the year is over!"

No doubt his girlfriend, Strictly pro Dianne Buswell, can help him get off on the right foot with Shirley.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Joe has expressed his desire to do a Rhumba with the Strictly head judge but it seems the invitation hasn't been extended
